Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
To start use libnspv:
```git clone https://github.com/jl777/libnspv
cd libnspv
./autogen.sh
./configure
make
./nspv
now you can issue curl commands as in ~/src/tools/nSPV_testvectors```

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @blackjok3r nice PR! dynamic peers, getpeerinfo and a bugfix for my opreturn extract!

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes I surprised myself, getting it done so fast. üòÉ Long day though.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all in C, no magic

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: makes it easy to get to the bottom of things

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: That slowed me down a fair bit, some crazy pointers used in there to get the duplicate peer fitler to work.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: better than buried in some template for a class for some data type that isnt even clear what structure it has

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This is true, I had to use libevent code to get the correct structures.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: anyway, as you see, it is very easy to add new api, so feel free to port over whatever is useful from iguana as i want to use libnspv as the codebase for useful crypto things

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: next step is to get a html wallet, but only using static html and having nspv dynamically generate it. that was there is no attack surface outside of nspv

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: mihailo is adding CC support to the komodod -nSPV=1 and it seems most all can be ported, but that is indeed a lot of custom tx construction

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: still for a specific CC, it wouldnt be that much work to add nspv support for it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: unless it needs a lot of blockchain data

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes, my idea was to just make a seperate libnspv for each contract. Hopefully get the lotto thing I made for LABS working with nSPV in new few weeks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the trick to solve that was to add fullnode p2p message support for getting the data more efficiently

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Although that pulls thousands of utxos for the first validation ü§î

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: can just make a new api function with the tx construction. nspv does not have to validate

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: listunspent/listtransactions got a new "filter" parameter that can be used to have the fullnode filter out the big list of unspents/txids and return only what fits. it is 32 bits total and i think 16bits might be allocated already

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: on the build side, i think it works in osx now. also windows and even 32 bit CPU might work

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Could always moce those heavy calls to a full node?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: or that is not practical?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, can always add a new p2p message

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that does require defining the structure (request and response), (de)serializer, issuing, global results and the message handling and the actual function that does it,

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all the existing messages follow the same pattern, so it shouldnt be too hard to figureout (after you are having the sleep)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes üòÉ very much needed.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is a "hardfork", so if any new messages are needed, sooner is better than after it spreads to the wild

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: can have differentl level of fullmodes via the NODE_NSPV nService bits

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: anyway, great work!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you are up to speed on nspv

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: In 1 day üòÑ

Content: it is 300kb of code total, just the pure essentials for doing transaction

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: borrowed heavily from iguana though

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Its really nice i like it. Simple and eas to follow, as long as you understand pointers

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sort of the new iguana

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is C, and assumed you understand pointers

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but yes, mosts coders i guess are afraid of them

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but use them indirectly and then cant figure out what is going on as they dont understand what is actually happening

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yep, üòÉ well I should get some rest. Let all this information sink in before I forget it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
@gcharang have you documented both the nSPV=1 for komodod and nspv?
nSPV=1 if added to the standard komodod puts it in nSPV superlite mode. it can also do most of the CC tx

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with nspv you specify the coin. it currently doesnt have a cli (though somebody could write such a program without much trouble)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: curl of the JSON is one way

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: http GET via url construction http://127.0.0.1:8901/method/getinfo

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: another way is POST, but not sure how to do that via browser

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i am also adding a json 2.0 compatible way of having a "params":[] array with the arguments inside it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and i think all the different ways needs to have specific examples to make it easy.  i heard using params array there are many existing tools to issue the api requests

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also a few details that might not be apparent. for txproof if you dont pass in the height, it wont return the merkleproof, but just the rawtx, so it is like getrawtransaction

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: list commands (unspent transactions) have a skipcount that lets you skip the first n entries, but it will always return the last entry, so it is an easy way to see if any new funds came in and confirmed, ie wait for the most recent utxo to change

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it also has a new filter field, which will be used to filter the list using filter specific defined values. this is to allow efficient support for CC tx creation that often has to search through many tx. also there is a CCflag that specifies whether you are looking for a CC address or a normal (p2pk, p2pkh, p2sh) address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: new mempool functions exist which range from returning the entire mempool, but also able to have a subset matching search parameters returned. please ask if anything is unclear

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @blackjok3r i think having an api call that exposes the internal gettransaction is a good new api to add as that will allow to get the specific retcode for that utxo. 0 means it is notarized, many errors possible during the notarization validation

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @Bryan_Beus not sure about your workload, but nspv has come a long ways pretty quick and is close to being beta, so getting it properly documented seems a good idea. focus on rapid integration to anything that wants to securely connect to any of the ecosystem coin networks directly and do transactions, or just get explorer level data
